descriptions: please provide a fix

Please provide a fix ASAP   thanks!

 

IT Support
Please expedite the software patch to address this issue.   Thanks!
more info   see Problem investigations for related incidents
Payments are getting dropped on the webstore.
more info
I just noticed the pale yellow colour on our websites looks a bit off. It should be #fffdf6 somewhere in our colours file, but it looks like it's #fafa95 instead. Can you look into it?
It doesn't need to be fancy - just replace with stars.
Update the homepage of Beyond Gravity website to lower the minimum number of people from 30 to 20.

Bouncy landings are no good.
Smooth is good, smooth is quick.

Maybe our pilots need more training?
We can arrange that at cost.
We forgot to change this when we wrote the booking system... the site is live now and no one can book the saturn deal :(
The current booking button is the default blue. We should make it red.

Loads of errors in the log files.

They seem to relate to the launch file system.
The one we copied from Apollo13.
- no not the movie version!

To demonstrate the correct placement for a feedback button, 
include a link after the about button in the appheader demo.

Thanks.
The buttons in the toolbar and forms are not consistent. The stylesheets should be updated to reflect the current design guidelines.
We need to create a pointer in the main.css file to instruct users to create child themes.
When placing links on the  on the website or design guidelines state that they should not be italicized. All links should retain the standard formatting of the text around it except colored in blue.

As an engineer I need to be able to make video calls back to my teammates on Earth. Calls usually last about 30 minutes and do require video and audio support. Screensharing is also required. 

We should contact all the local network providers to see if they have preferred services that work with their networks.

As an employee I'd need to understand the rules and regulations of Beyond Gravity while working at the company on Mars. 

In general, rules should be the same as they are on Earth unless local rules on Mars prohibit otherwise. Please file any discrepancies in JIRA so that we can review them and make decisions that work for our Martian colleagues.

We will need an office manager to handle all of the day to day tasks of running the Martian office. This person should: 
* Have local knowledge about operations on Mars 
* 3-5 years of building experience management 
* Can work during normal business hours on Mars 
* Can lift objects up to 50 pounds as if they were on Earth.

As a system administrator I need to review the network architecture diagram for the MARS office to see that it works for: 
* Initial fill for 25 employees 
* Can scale to 50 employees in 1 year 
* Has wireless support for 40 guests at any given period.

As a traveler life happens. All participants should be able to cancel their reservation in a group trip. The system should process any refunds or future travel vouchers as appropriate and notify the trip organizer that someone has cancelled.

Currently LocalTransportController makes an assumption that all the participants in the group are on the same itinerary. Many of our local travel providers limit reservations to 4 people. 

The UI should walk the user through booking a large travel vendor for the group and allow certain users to opt out for a personal space craft.

With large teams we have the potential to have a relationship with every traveler who travels with Beyond Gravity. 

If a user is not registered with Beyond Gravity we should email them at the time booking with their itinerary and a link to sign up with Beyond Gravity. 

When they sign up within 7 days of booking Beyond Gravity will honor their BG Rewards from the master booking.

When a customer books a trip more than 15 people we should reward them with BG points. We should distribute BG points equally to all registered BG users at the time of booking. Rewards should be as follows: 

* 1-15 users - Standard BG rewards 
* 16-20 users - Standard BG rewards + 5% bonus 
* 21-25 users - Standard BG rewards + 8% bonus 
* 26-30 users - Standard BG rewards + 10% bonus

Currently FlightController makes an assumption that all the participants in the group are on the same itinerary. Many of our airline travel providers limit reservations to 6 people. To accommodate larger groups we need to have multiple airline reservations on one group reservation. Customers need to be able to select a number of airlines (or several reservations with the same airline). Customers should not be able to book the reservation until all participants have a confirmed flight.

Currently LodgingController makes an assumption that all the participants in the group are on the same itinerary. Many of our hotel travel providers limit reservations to 8 people. To accommodate larger groups we need to have multiple hotel/motel reservations on one group reservation. Customers need to be able to select a number of hotels (or several reservations at the same hotel). Customers should not be able to book the reservation until all participants have a hotel room.

Currently LodgingController makes an assumption that all the participants in the group are on the same itinerary. Many of our hotel travel providers limit reservations to 8 people. To accommodate larger groups we need to have multiple hotel/motel reservations on one group reservation. 

Group lodging reservations should be a collection of itineraries with a number of providers that the user selects stored as one data structure.

Currently FlightController makes an assumption that all the participants in the group are on the same itinerary. Many of our flight travel providers limit reservations to 6 people. To accommodate larger groups we need to have multiple flight itineraries on one reservation. 

Group Flights should be a collection of itineraries with a number of carriers that the user selects stored as one data structure.

As a user I want to be able to book a trip for up to 30 people using beyondgravity.team. Currently I have to book 5 trips of six people each. 

When booking a trip in the UI we should aim to keep the request screen the same but change the validation to limit group size to 30.

As a user I'd like to have a customized experience powered by SeeSpaceEZ. SeeSpaceEZ should look at my past travel history as well as any deals going on and suggest trips for me. 

We should favor destinations that we believe the user will enjoy vs the best deal at any given time.

As a customer I'd like to browse my travel history. When I request user details using our REST API we should include travel details. 

The URL is: 
http://staging.beyondgravity.team/rest/api/2/user/UserID 

We should return all trips in the past three years with: 
* Trip ID 
* Trip Title 
* Date of Trip 

We can then pass the trip id to 
http://staging.beyondgravity.team/rest/api/2/reservation/ to get further trip details.

As part of the Saturn Summer Sizzle we'd like to have feedback from prior travelers to Saturn. 

We can use a mixture of text and video content, but we need about 5 travelers that can contribute to the Beyond Gravity website. We'd like to focus our potential customers as to why Saturn is the destination of choice for them.

We need to learn about our customers as they navigate the sale site. We should have a plan around: 
* Understanding how long a user stays on our site 
* If the user doesn't purchase a travel package, what assets did they not see? 
* How does a user come to our site?

The Saturn Summer Sizzle is the target campaign for Beyond Gravity this quarter. We need to build out a launch plan so the company knows what to expect over the next two quarters. 

Launch plan should indicate any needed resources and estimated timing of deliverables.

We expect high demand for the summer sale to Saturn. We need to confirm: 
* Three air travel providers 
* Five accommodation providers 

Each provider must conform to the Beyond Gravity travel agreement and be able to provide travel for the whole engagement.
The Saturn Summer Sizzle is our annual sale and promotion to Saturn. We need engaging videos on our website to highlight why Saturn is the destination of choice.

The Saturn Summer Sizzle is our annual sale and promotion to Saturn. We need engaging copy on our website to emphasize the following themes: 
* The view of Saturn's rings are at an all time high 
* Saturn is a premier planet with many natural features not found on other plantets 
* Booking with Beyond Gravity during the promotion will save teams an average of 20% 
* Booking hotel and travel together saves the customer an extra 5%

The Saturn Summer Sizzle is our annual sale and promotion to Saturn. We need a logo that emphasizes the beauty of Saturn's rings this time of year. The logo should work with Beyond Gravity's existing site branding.

As a customer I need to see that Beyond Gravity is running a team summer special to Saturn. We need banner ads in the following sizes to work with our partners: 

* 468 x 60 Full Banner 
* 728 x 90 Leaderboard 
* 160 x 600 Skyscraper 
* 160 x 600 Skyscraper 
* 120 x 60 Button

Now that Pluto is no longer a planet, there is increased demand to see Pluto out in space. 

Please research options for travel to Pluto so we can see if it's the right market for Beyond Gravity to move into. Also consider local travel partners with whom we might be able to network in the area.

We have found that many group tours need a way to efficiently transport the entire team between the airport and hotel, travel between the hotel and local destinations, as well as book traditional tours. 

Mars is our largest market in the inner Solar System. Phobos and Deimos Tours is an all location provider in the local area. Let's engage them on the SeeSpaceEZ booking system.

Beyond Gravity is looking to work with a few key travel providers for our annual Summer Saturn Sizzle. The Red Titan Hotel has been a popular destination because of it's views of Saturn. They don't handle large groups well though. 

We should negotiate preferred pricing as well as evangelize the SeeSpaceEZ platform to help them scale with us.

We need to build strategic relationship with space carriers to negotiate preferred travel discounts for our customers. 

Jupiter Express is a new discount travel provider that specializes in outer solar system travel. This market has typically been held by the luxury carriers but Jupiter Express has good service to Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. 

Jupiter Express can also be a key travel partner for the Saturn Summer Sale. Let's see if we can get them on the SeeSpaceEZ Travel Platform.

We need to build strategic relationship with space carriers to negotiate preferred travel discounts for our customers. 

There is strong demand to see the Sun in a day tour from Earth. SunSpot Tours has regular service from Earth and the Moon to see the Sun. Let's see if we can get them on the SeeSpaceEZ Travel Platform.

We need to build strategic relationship with space carriers to negotiate preferred travel discounts for our customers. 

JetShuttle SpaceWays has great service from Asia and Europe to the moon as well as the inner solar system. They fill a gap in our portfolio for inner solar system travel from Europe. 

Let's see if we can get them on the See Space EZ Travel Platform.

A number of our users engage with us at blogs.beyondgravity.team. We should have a blog post that is the target for our email campaign announcing the Summer Saturn Sale. 

The blog should feature our new travel partners on the SeeSpaceEZ travel platform and showcase how we make space travel easy for teams.

The summer travel season is coming up and we need to let our customers know about our targeted sale to Saturn. Saturn's sheer beauty make it an exciting travel destinations. 

The email campaign should focus on deep discounts on fares as well as accommodations. Groups of over 20 people save extra on both airfare and hotel stays. 

See [~kowens] for more details.

Our clients need an easy way to transport large groups between: 
* Airport and Hotel 
* Hotel and group venues like a large group dinner or offsite 
* Traditional Tours 

Saturn Shuttle Lines seems to be the right provider to engage on the SeeSpaceEZ platform. Our initial reviews indicate they have the right level of local knowledge and charisma with our clients.

Beyond Gravity has found that some individuals prefer to see Saturn on their own instead of being on a large tour group. Initial talks with Speedy seem to indicate that they are a good candidate for working with Beyond Gravity. 

Goal is to enable them to work with us on the SeeSpaceEZ booking system so individuals can book personal travel in conjunction with their group tour.

Beyond Gravity is looking to work with a few key travel providers for our annual Summer Saturn Sizzle. Saturn's Rings Resort has been a popular destination and is able to handle larger groups on short notice. 

We should negotiate preferred pricing with them as part of the Beyond Gravity Preferred Provider Program

Our Mars office will need many of the same supplies available on Earth: 
* Chairs 
* Desks 
* Pens/Paper 

We should establish a strategic relationship with one of the local vendors to give us preferred pricing rather than buying everything as needed at full retail price.

As a company we will have the same meal service on Mars as we do on earth. Meal service should include: 
# Free beverages and snacks throughout the day 
# Free breakfast and lunch 
## Both meals should include a protein 
## Vegetarian options should be available 
# Dinner will be a subsidized program at 50% of typical outside cost

After we get our Mars Tax ID number, the company needs to integrate Mars' tax code into the system. Mars has differing tax codes based on the employee's location, so we will likely require an update from our payroll vendor.
As a business we need to have a relationship with the Mars Ministry of Revenue such that we can withhold taxes from our employees for tax purposes.

To ensure a smooth rollout and to have company goals for our Mars office clearly communicated, we need to ensure that each department has 90 day plans. 

Each 90 day plan needs to have 3-5 goals that are aggressive, but attainable for the teams to meet. Each plan should list out any resources required from the main office here on Earth.
As a business entity we need to register with the Mars Ministry of Labor to ensure we can operate legally on the planet of Mars as well as pay our employees.

When we deploy a SeeSpaceEZ Plus server in cloud after about 100,000 requests we see that the server runs out of memory and crashes. The cloud platform recognizes this and regenerates a new server, but we need to understand why we have so many servers dying. 

We've not seen this issue in the SeeSpaceEZ platform. It seems to be related to the new code. We started seeing this issue about 6 hours ago.

When looking up flight details the speed of that call has now gone over 5 seconds. We'd like this call to typically take 2-3 seconds. Given our expansion over the past few months, I see the performance issues in the database. 

We should review all the indexes for the flight tables and run a slow query search to see if we can track down any performance concerns.

When I request reservation using our REST API I get a 500 error. 

The URL is: 
http://staging.beyondgravity.team/rest/api/2/reservation/99808 

It seems to be specific to this reservation as other reservations do not experience this error.
More APIs would be an example.
Let's bring it out of this world.
Not sure why we settled on 15 in the past.

Anyone seen Total Recall?
The Arnie version of course!
Inspiration: https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/core/use-cases
Introduce the Beyond Gravity after launch, including the team members' age, education and experience. Highlight how they use JIRA Core.

We are preparing for our go-live in two weeks and can't import our customers accounts that are in JSON format.  The admin guides says this is support.   We have deployed Dashloop Logistics manager 5.0   Can this bug be addressed or do you have a patch for it?
I noticed our renewal is coming up and we want to add new licenses   Can someone please help with this?
I've already registered for an account using my social security number ***********.
It would be helpful to have access to the admin guide in the product   This would make it much easier
unable to import   DB error 505 displays.
Unable to import contact list

After restart several of the remote workstations at the Miami terminal fail to connect to the GPS etrace reporting system.  We double checked the hardware setup and everything looks good.   This appears to be a software issue.   We are running v5 patch 1.1
this happens when we setup an Air Export on 192.168.0.1
we are seeing some issues with the e-trace reports setup.....
can you provide docs for this?
we are having issues with the GPS configuration for truck locations
please send me
Can you help with updating our account to annual billing with my credit card number [*******************

We've integrated dashloop and we are seeing.....

Looks like a bug
Got a product eval question about Dashloop.....
We tried to apply our license upgrade but the BG logistics application won't accept it.  Can you please help.

* You are now looking at an issue in one of your preset queues. This is where your agents work on your end users' requests.
* On your left hand side are the queues where you can easily see all requests coming from your end users. 
* You can also see what this issue looks like in the Customer Portal by selecting the *View customer request* link to the right.

----
Got it? Now click *Resolve this issue* and add a comment to complete this request.
----
